NadineScene1: ^Hello, you must be Rae Voll. I'm Anna Nyugen. Your attorney.

^Thank you for coming, Anna Nyugen… You can call me Nadine, Nadine Kanna, my real name. I know this case is a disaster. The press is calling me a backstabber, a diva, a monster — everything. But I swear I didn't hurt Madeline.
^She is insufferable, arrogant, and grossly overrated, but she didn't deserve to die.
^That's why I'm here. I'll need the truth, unfiltered.
^Tell me what happened the night of the gala.
^Madeline's death… it shocked everyone. She was the biggest artist on the charts. But honestly, it wasn't the biggest surprise… After all, things are messy backstage.

^There is something no one talks about publicly. Some people say that Madeline stole songs— lyrics, concepts, melodies. Her manager kept it buried. Anyone who got close enough to the truth… Well, they were silenced.
^Madeline's manager will fight tooth and nail to keep her reputation spotless. She adored Madeline's career more than the woman behind it.
^I've handled people like that before. She'll be a hard nut to crack.
^I had to maintain an aggressive public relationship with her to stay out of trouble.
^And the prosecution thinks this rivalry with Madeline gave you a motive.
^Let's go over your alibi. Every second matters.
^I was with my brother for most of the time after I arrived. His name is Olaf. Here's his number.
^We met up shortly after my arrival to catch up while I took him for a walk around the place.
^At around 6 pm, I realized that I had forgotten my sunhat backstage and decided to retrieve it after our conversation.
^Was there anything unusual? Did you see Madeline at any point?
^Nothing was out of place as I recall…
^And when did you go retrieve your sunhat?
^I think I left around 6:15? I'm not sure, because I got lost backstage.
^From my past experience rehearsing at the place, it usually took at least five minutes to go backstage from the lounge if it's not crowded. The walk that day was longer than that.
^When I walked past the backstage restroom, I heard a loud noise coming from the beauty room.
^So I ran into the beauty room… and I saw Madeline.
^I saw her laying on the floor with blood everywhere…
^I screamed and ran out… I bumped into somebody, but I was too stressed out to see who.
^The backstage should be easy to navigate, but I wasn't able to get anywhere that night. When I think about it, I must have taken a wrong turn at some point.
^And that was when the police came.
^I don't know the time when that happened… but I had been spending all my other time that day with Olaf.
^Hey boss, sorry to interrupt! Just wanna tell ya I got permission from the detective to go check out the backstage! Thought you'd want the heads-up. See you there! Okayyyyy bye!
^What you just told me about Olaf is very important, thank you. I'll give him a call later today.
^Alright. Nadine Kanna, you are my client. My only priority is the truth and clearing your name.
^Thank you, Anna Nyugen. I trust you.
